Class Evaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Evaluator

  • public class Evaluator
extends Object
    The Evaluator class takes a mathamatical string expression from in-fix notation to post-fix notation. Then returns the equivlent value after performing all the math in the string. The Evaluator also takes variables that are lowercased. To set a variable it requires a name followed by and = and the numerical String expression To convert to postfix the program uses the InfixToPostfix written by Erwin Seguinte

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Evaluator()
      This constructor in Evaluator initalizes the object to properly handle variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Evaluator

        public Evaluator()
        This constructor in Evaluator initalizes the object to properly handle variables. To do this the object initalizes a private map into a TreeMap that is conditioned for String to String use. This is were all variables are held for the object itself.

    • Method Detail

      • math

        public String math(String math)
        This method in Evaluator processes the variables that need to be set with the pattern (name = expression). If the expression is a variable the methos removes spaces and seperates the inital string by using the = as the divider. Then checks to see if the variable name is all lowercase letters then finally sets the value of variable. If the expression is not a variable is sent to another math methods that excepts InfixToPostfix as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        math - String whether for a variable or a normal expression
        Returns:
        String that was evaluated
        Throws:
        Error - when any kind of exception is found

      • math

        public String math(InfixToPostfix postfix)
        This method in Evaluator processes the other mathamatical expressions besides variables. This is an overloaded method that takes InfixToPostfix instead of Strings to evaluate the expression. The InfixToPostfix class should catch most errors in the expression if not this method if it throws an error is caught in the previous method.
        Parameters:
        postfix - InfixToPostfix expression
        Returns:
        String that was evaluated
        Throws:
        Error - when any kind of exception is found

      • operation

        public String operation(String num1,
                        String num2,
                        String operator)
        This is used as an operand comparison for Evaluator objects' that takes 3 values converting the first two values into Big Integer and evaluates them with the operand. Since the Big Integer's power method takes a Big Integer and an int one of the values is converted to an int when math is done
        Parameters:
        num1 - String that holds digits to be evaluated
        num2 - String that holds digits to be evaluated
        operator - String that stores the type of operatio to be evaluated
        Returns:
        returns a string of the operator math of the two digit strings

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Simple embedded unit-test for Evaluator Class.
        Parameters:
        args - The string arguments passed in main
